group_1.textRight: It's one of the places I researched last night:

group_1.textCenter: It should be at the end of this path.

group_1.textRight: Hmm... Perhaps it's a lover's hideaway of some@sort?
No, it's not like that. There's a strange urban@legend associated with this place.

group_1.narration: "Once, there was a woman married to a sailor.@She was always worried for his safety, and every day,@she went to the lighthouse and gazed upon the sea,@waiting for his ship to return."
"Every time he returned home safe and sound,@she was there to greet him at the lighthouse.@Hence, visiting it every day@became a critical part of her routine."
"Then, one day,@her husband departed on his ship,@but this time, he did not return.@And still she waited for him,@day after day, year after year, for decades."
"Inevitably, she passed away@before she could see him again.@Yet more decades passed, and the lighthouse,@which saw no visitors for all that time,@was slated to be torn down."
"But after the mysterious deaths@of the workers who came to demolish it,@the tear-down was put on an indefinite hiatus."

group_1.textLeft: Does that mean... the ghost of the wife who@died waiting for her husband...

group_1.textRight: Yes, I think that's what people believe.
Thus, with that sort of reputation, exploring the@lighthouse has become a test of courage of sorts.

group_1.textLeft: H-hey...! M-maybe we shouldn't do this...

group_1.textRight: If there really is a ghost, it'd be the perfect@antagonist for our film!
We can work together and fend it off for our@climax!

group_1.textLeft: And if we can get a real ghost on camera,@we'll get a high rating for sure!

group_1.textRight: But if we go there to mess around... we could@get killed!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I mean, if all this stuff about the ghost@turns out to be real, we're screwed!

group_1.textRight: We deal with Witches all the time. Do ghosts@really scare you that much?
If there really is a ghost, we'll incorporate it into@our movie.
If there isn't, then we'll have our sixth member@play the part.

group_1.textLeft: Our movie is supposed to have six students in it.

group_1.textRight: I concur with Miss Hikaru's idea.

group_1.textLeft: I'm scared of meeting a real ghost, but...
If we got a sixth person to pretend to be a ghost,@then... I'd be happy with that.
(I can't really say no, can I?)
I guess we can go with that...
